FuncDef:
The aaa abnormal-offline-record command configures the system to record unexpected logout events.
The undo aaa abnormal-offline-record command cancels the configuration.
By default, the system is configured to record unexpected logout events.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After the aaa abnormal-offline-record command is run, the system records unexpected logout events in the memory for administrators to manage the device and locate faults. If only the unexpected logout events during a specific period are required, run the undo aaa abnormal-offline-record command to disable the system from recording unexpected logout events. After the undo aaa abnormal-offline-record command is run, the system does not record unexpected logout events in the memory, which increases the memory space but brings risks that administrators cannot view unexpected logout information.
Follow-up Procedure
After the system is configured to record unexpected logout events, you can run the display aaa abnormal-offline-record command to view the unexpected logout information.
